intro: [WRONG START] Rosa × reversa Burlei, commonly known as the double-flowered climbing rose. It is a hybrid rose species characterized by its vigorous climbing habit and large, double blooms. The plant features dark green, glossy foliage and produces fragrant, pink to red flowers. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and as a decorative vine. Rosa × reversa Burlei requires full sun and well-draining soil to thrive.
